alert.note: Alert for Custer (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 31 at 7:32PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Custer County through 800 PM MDT... At 731 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 29 miles northwest of Ekalaka, moving northwest at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail, along with very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Watch for localized ponding of water in low lying areas due to the heavy rain. Locations impacted include... Mizpah and Knowlton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
